content.text: In 1991, the body of a man was found frozen beneath a glacier in Italy. Researchers named him Ötzi. It was determined that Ötzi died 5300 years ago and that his body is the oldest mummified human body ever found. Scientists have successfully extracted DNA from the nucleus of his frozen cells.

content.prompt: Describe the process scientists would use on a small sample of Ötzi’s DNA to obtain larger quantities of identical DNA.
Using gel electrophoresis, scientists discovered that there were four different types of blood on Ötzi’s clothes. Their results were as follows.(inline IMAGE)

questions.prompt: Which blood sample on Ötzi’s clothes belongs to Ötzi?
Propose **one** hypothesis that would explain the presence of the other blood samples on Ötzi’s clothes.
Analysis of mammalian proteins provides evidence of evolutionary relationships.\n\nExplain how amino acid differences in a protein can indicate evolutionary relationships.
The development of bipedalism in hominins is believed to have had a very significant effect on human evolution.\n\nDescribe **two** effects of bipedalism on hominin behaviour.
